poem:
Title: "The Numbers of Wane"

Inflation fumbles, falls and feints,
In the checkerboard of thrift,
Petrol, bread and cakes at the discount saint,
Yet we feel not the wealth's subtle shift.

"Further to go," the money-men say,
While we sip from cups that taste of clay,
In an obvious world, with an expected weight,
Neither the prices nor life will abate.
